byline.contributor: Paula Moura and Claire Rigby contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil.

abstract: Brazil's scandal-plagued legislators water down landmark anticorruption bill, working late into night even as Pres Michel Temer declares three days of official mourning for victims of plane crash; modified bill would significantly reduce authority of prosecutors and judges charged with investigating political corruption cases.
lead_paragraph: With Brazilians stunned by the crash of a plane carrying a soccer team, lawmakers made dead-of-night changes to a bill meant to keep officials honest.
snippet: With Brazilians stunned by the crash of a plane carrying a soccer team, lawmakers made dead-of-night changes to a bill meant to keep officials honest....

headline.main: As a Distracted Brazil Mourns, Lawmakers Gut a Corruption Bill
headline.print_headline: As Brazilians Mourn,  Legislators Gut Graft Bill
